ProbeTracing

Contains subroutines that can be used to trace the runout of a part

Functions
Select
call ProbeTracing.Select(
component
);

Initialize the touch probe or OCT system for automatic part tracing

Parameters
component

either COMPONENT_OCT or COMPONENT_PROBE

Deselect
call ProbeTracing.Deselect();

Deactivate the currently selected tracing component after use

TraceCurrentSurface
call ProbeTracing.TraceCurrentSurface(
numDegrees,
numPoints
);

Trace the runout of the part, over the specified arc (in degrees), for the number of specified capture points.

Parameters
numDegrees

the number of degrees to rotate while tracing the surface

numPoints

the amount of positional data points to be captured while rotating

GetStatus
call ProbeTracing.GetStatus(
&result
);

Query the status of the probing component

Reponse Parameters
&result

the current probing status

Status Values
0

the OCT component is selected, or the probe is not triggered

-1

The probe is triggered

SetProbeSpeed
call ProbeTracing.SetProbeSpeed(
speed
);

Set the probe move speed to the specified value.

Notes

Must be within PROBE_MIN_SPEED and PROBE_MAX_SPEED

Parameters
speed

the speed to set the probe

SetSurfaceNormal
call ProbeTracing.SetSurfaceNormal(
xcomp,
ycomp,
zcomp
);

Set the surface normal for calculating contact position.  Assumes part coordinates.

Parameters
xcomp

the 'X' part of the normal vector

ycomp

the 'Y' part of the normal vector

zcomp

the 'Z' part of the normal vector

SetTriggerMoveDistance
call ProbeTracing.SetTriggerMoveDistance(
distance
);

Set the distance that the probe must move before triggering

Parameters
distance

the desired trigger move distance

Notes

Must be between PROBE_MIN_MOVEDISTANCE and PROBE_MAX_MOVEDISTANCE

ReturnAfterTriggerOn
call ProbeTracing.ReturnAfterTriggerOn();

Command the probe to return to its previous position after triggering

See Also

ProbeTracing.ReturnAfterTriggerOff

ReturnAfterTriggerOff
call ProbeTracing.ReturnAfterTriggerOff();

Command the probe to remain in its current position after triggering

See Also

ProbeTracing.ReturnAfterTriggerOn

GetSpeed
call ProbeTracing.GetSpeed(
&probeSpeed
);

Get the current move speed of the probe.

Response Parameters
&probeSpeed

The current speed

GetTriggerPosition
call ProbeTracing.GetTriggerPosition(
&xPos,
&yPos,
&zPos
);

Get the position of the probe when it was triggered

Response Parameters
&xPos

The current X position of the machine

&yPos

The current Y position of the machine

&zPos

The current Z position of the machine

GetContactPoints
call ProbeTracing.GetContactPoints(
&xPos,
&yPos,
&zPos
);

Get the current position when the probe makes contact

Response Parameters
&xPos

The current X position of the machine

&yPos

The current Y position of the machine

&zPos

The current Z position of the machine

ConvertPartVectorToMachineVector
call ProbeTracing.ConvertPartVectorToMachineVector(
xPartVector,
yPartVector,
zPartVector,
&xVector,
&yVector,
&zVector
);

Converts a unit vector from part coordinates to machine coordinates

Parameters
xPartVector

The current X unit vector in part coordinates

yPartVector

The current Y unit vector in part coordinates

zPartVector

The current Z unit vector in part coordinates

Response Parameters
&xVector

The X unit vector in machine coordinates

&yVector

The Y unit vector in machine coordinates

&zVector

The Z unit vector in machine coordinates

ProbeMachCoord
call ProbeTracing.ProbeMachCoord(
ProbeDir_i,
ProbeDir_j,
ProbeDir_k,
&res
);

Perform a probe operation in machine coordinates

Parameters
ProbeDir_i

The 'i' (or 'x') probe direction

ProbeDir_j

the 'j' (or 'y') probe direction

ProbeDir_k

the 'k' (or 'z') probe direction

See Also

ProbeTracing.ProbePartCoord

Reponse Parameters
&res

the result of the operation

ProbePartCoord
call ProbeTracing.ProbePartCoord(
ProbeDir_i,
ProbeDir_j,
ProbeDir_k,
&res
);

Perform a probe operation in part coordinates

Parameters
ProbeDir_i

The 'i' (or 'x') probe direction

ProbeDir_j

the 'j' (or 'y') probe direction

ProbeDir_k

the 'k' (or 'z') probe direction

Reponse Parameters
&res

the result of the operation

See Also

ProbeTracing.ProbeMachCoord

Unwind
call ProbeTracing.Unwind();

Re-centers the machine position after tracing a surface
